Died

(2017-05-09)
(aged 89)
Beijing, People's Republic of China
Qian Qichen hailed from a prominent scholarly family from Waigang (外冈), Jiading, Jiangsu province

Qian played a critical role in shaping China's foreign policy during CCP general secretary Jiang Zemin's administration, and was a key player handling the return to Chinese sovereignty of Hong Kong and Macau.
